docs.lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton.
docs.abstract: If one views children as the nation's economic future, it is sensible to make their health care the financial responsibility of society as a whole, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: If one views children as the nation's economic future, it is sensible to make their health care the financial responsibility of society as a whole, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: FREDDIE OFFICIAL FOUND DEAD David B. Kellermann, the acting chief financial officer at Freddie Mac, died, apparently in a suicide. Colleagues and friends said Mr. Kellermann, 41, had been working nonstop and had been under enormous stress. RECESSION IN JAPAN Japan is seeking to send home Latin Americans who are being laid off in the recession. Wellington Shibuya, left, a foreign worker who lost his job, said, ''They put up with us as long as they needed the labor.'' [B1.]

docs.lead_paragraph: The latest version of a rescue plan for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority appeared to hit its own stumbling blocks, as a group of suburban Democratic state senators said they still opposed the regional payroll tax at its center.

headline.main: Latest M.T.A. Rescue Plan in Trouble
